trans-unit.source: Designates a property to represent a database association, such as a foreign key relationship.
Use this attribute to represent an association in a database, such as the relationship between a foreign key and a primary key.
In the following example, the `Order` class includes an <xref:System.Data.Linq.Mapping.AssociationAttribute> attribute to associate Orders with Customers.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.Linq.Mapping.AssociationAttribute"></xref> class.
When placed on a 1:1 association whose foreign key members are all non-nullable, deletes the object when the association is set to null.
Setting to `True` deletes the object.
The default value is `False`.
Gets or sets delete behavior for an association.
If set to null, no delete behavior is added.
For example, "CASCADE" would add "ON DELETE CASCADE" to the foreign-key relationship.
In the following example, the rule is to take no action.
A string representing the rule.
Gets or sets the member as the foreign key in an association representing a database relationship.
Default = `false`.
Gets or sets the indication of a uniqueness constraint on the foreign key.
When true, this property indicates a true 1:1 relationship.
Default = `false`.
Gets or sets one or more members of the target entity class as key values on the other side of the association.
For multiple members, use a comma-separated list.

The key is not required to match the primary key or foreign key, but the user-stated cardinality (0-1 for <xref:System.Data.Linq.EntityRef%601> or 0-n for <xref:System.Data.Linq.EntitySet%601>) is assumed to be true.
Default = Id of the related class.
Gets or sets members of this entity class to represent the key values on this side of the association.
For multiple members, use a comma-separated list.

The key is not required to match the primary key or foreign key, but the user-stated cardinality (0-1 for <xref:System.Data.Linq.EntityRef%601> or 0-n for <xref:System.Data.Linq.EntitySet%601>) is assumed to be true.
Default = Id of the containing class.
